= Differences with the java version =
In the groovy version of chromattic, the types are not abstracts and annotations are used directly on the properties.
The chromattic engine in the groovy version is exactly the same that the Java version. Thus before read this part, please read and understand the java version.
A simple example of code using groovy version of chrommatic : ##Page.groovy## (the equivalent to [[Page.java>>#getting_started_page_object]]) in groovy is : (((
{{code language=GROOVY href="org/chromattic/docs/reference/groovy/Page.groovy"}}{{/code}})))
= Build groovy project with chromattic =
Chromattic is plugged to groovy classes at the compile time (this operation is based on AST transformation). Thus the only thing to do is to have the chromattic.groovy jar in the classpath of the compilation.
== Maven building ==
Just add the maven dependencies in the pom.xml. (((
{{code language=XML}}...
<dependency>
  <groupId>org.chromattic</groupId>
  <artifactId>chromattic.groovy</artifactId>
  <score>compile</score>
</dependency>
...{{/code}})))
== Ant building ==
Add the chromattic.groovy jar in the class path in the build.xml. (((
{{code language=XML}}...
<classpath>
  <pathelement path="${classpath}"/>
  <pathelement location="lib/chromattic.groovy-1.1.0-SNAPSHOT-jar-with-dependencies.jar"/>
</classpath>
...{{/code}})))
== Groovyc building ==
Just add the chromattic.groovy jar in the classpath with the ##-classpath## argument
{{code}}groovyc Page.groovy -classpath chromattic.groovy-1.1.0-SNAPSHOT-jar-with-dependencies.jar{{/code}}

= Runtime dependencies =

To use Chromattic, you must specify a JCR implementation in the runtime classpath. For example chromattic.exo maven depepndency : (((
{{code language=XML}}...
<dependency>
  <groupId>org.chromattic</groupId>
  <artifactId>chromattic.exo</artifactId>
  <scope>runtime</scope>
</dependency>
...{{/code}})))

= How to access to JCR data through chromattic objects in groovy =
Simply access to the property content thanks to getter, setter or property (((
{{code language=groovy}}...
/**
  * Initialize "page", an instance of the Page type.
  */

// get the value
String name1 = page.getName()
// or
String name2 = page.name


// set the value
page.setName("foo")
// or
page.name = "bar"
...{{/code}})))
